item.title: Interest Rate vs. APR: What Florida Borrowers Need to Know to Compare Lenders
item.description:
Lender A offers 6.50%. Lender B offers 6.625%. You pick Lender A because the rate is lower. Then you see total costs at closing and realize you made the wrong choice. Here’s why APR matters more than rateâ€”and how to use it.

What Interest Rate Actually Means

Your interest rate is the percentage the lender charges to borrow money. It determines your monthly principal and interest payment.

Example:

  • $300,000 loan at 6.50% = $1,896/month (P&I)
  • $300,000 loan at 6.625% = $1,920/month (P&I)

The 6.50% rate saves you $24/month. Seems like an easy choice, right? Not so fast.
